etymology.description: 送(send) + 秋波(autumn waves; metaphor for alluring eye-glances) = cast amorous glances.
etymology.interpretation: Evokes ripples of clear autumn water as a metaphor for sparkling, flirtatious eyes. Used playfully to describe making eyes at someone in a teasing or suggestive way.

parts.english: to send; to deliver; to see off; to give (as a gift)
autumn; fall; harvest season; (poetic) melancholic mood

examples.chinese: 她隔着人群向他送秋波(她隔著人群向他送秋波)。
examples.pinyin: Tā gézhe rénqún xiàng tā sòng qiūbō.
examples.english: She cast amorous glances at him across the crowd.

examples.chinese: 他故意对服务员送秋波(他故意對服務員送秋波)，逗得朋友笑个不停(逗得朋友笑個不停)。
examples.pinyin: Tā gùyì duì fúwùyuán sòng qiūbō, dòu de péngyou xiào ge bù tíng.
examples.english: He deliberately made eyes at the waiter, making his friends laugh nonstop.

examples.chinese: 他向新来的同事送秋波(他向新來的同事送秋波)，气得女友翻白眼(氣得女友翻白眼)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiàng xīn lái de tóngshì sòng qiūbō, qì de nǚyǒu fān báiyǎn.
examples.english: He sent flirtatious glances to the new colleague, making his girlfriend roll her eyes.
